Text:
Setup
-HP G72-250US
-Intel Core i3 M350 2.27GHz
-8Gb PC3-10700 RAM
-Win7 64-bit SP1
-SB X-Fi Surround 5.1

Process
-Original 16/44.1 files joined in Wavelab 6
-DC offset removed, this will yield a file with a bit depth of 18-24 bits
-Resample to 384kHz in Wavelab w/crystal resampler ultra(slow) relax background priority
-Perform 2-pass recording process in Wavelab @ 64-bit float/384kHz 0db gain

As reported in Wavelab:
-Original 16/44 - Apparent Bit Resolution = 16, Peak = -0.048db
-DC Offset Removed - Apparent Bit Resolution = 19, Peak = -0.048db
-Final Recording - Apparent Bit Resolution = 39, Peak = 0.803db

-Convert newly recorded 64/384 file to DSD128 with Weiss Saracon 1.61-27*
*this step allows me to keep nearly all of the detail of the 64/384 file when going to lower bit depths/sampling frequencies

Settings in Weiss Saracon:
-Modulator Type - CRFB 10th Order
-Sample Rate - 5.6448MHz
-Gain (db SACD) - 0db
-Stabilizer - off
-Dither - off

-Convert newly created DSD file to 16-bit/44.1kHz wav file with Weiss Saracon 1.61-27 w/0db gain and TPDF dither
-Apply precision 6db gain* and MBIT+ Dither (Noise Shaping - Medium, Dither Amount - High, Auto-blanking - on) in Wavelab w/Izotope Ozone 4 VST Plugin
*DSD -> PCM = -6db
-Flac encode level 0 with Trader's Little Helper
-Tag and pic with xrecode II

I approve.  And thank you for doing this.  

I'm tracking this right now at full volume:
Arcam for stream decoding, preamp, and power.
Linn Komri and Tukans.

If you want to hear this album like it should sound, download this now.

Thanks beavis39 for the effort to improve the original digital.  I think you have. For me though the only way to listen to this incredible album is to download this:

http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7431002

Thanks guy for the support. Personally every vinyl rip I have heard of this doesn't hold a candle to mine. That is just my opinion though. Thanks for posting the link, this way others can compare and see which one is their favorite.
